root.title: 56 Adir Kan
root.place: The inscription is located on Adir Kan rock in 20 km from village Inya near well-known Chui deer stone (in 726 km) in 200 m from Chui highway. The inscription is written on surface faced to south west in 15.8 cm from the foot of small area.
root.description: The horizontal line consists of 9 signs.
root.size: Height of signs is between 1.5 and 2.2 cm.
root.investigation: Kadykov and Elin found in 1976. Nadeliyaev studied in 1978 for the first time. Valiliyev, Kyzlasov and others studied later. Publication: Kocheev 523.

pdf.f_title: Свод древнетюркских рунических памятников Горного Алтая. Горно-Алтайск: АКИН, 2006. – 52 с.

refs.ref: Кызласов И.Л. Рунические письменности евразийских степей.-М. 1994.-С. 318.-Рис. 18.
